info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 5 at 12:41AM CDT until July 5 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
FFWEWX
The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Travis County in south central Texas...
* Until 500 AM CDT.
* At 1241 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in FM 1431 north of Lake Travis. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 6 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Western Travis County and far eastern Burnet County around Lake Travis. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Park, Leander, Lago Vista, Jonestown and Briarcliff.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Colorado River, Lick Creek, North Fork Brushy Creek, Fall Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Brushy Creek, Red Bluff Creek, South Fork Brushy Creek, Negro Branch, Cow Creek, Bee Creek and Post Oak Creek.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WESTERN TRAVIS COUNTY AND FAR EASTERN BURNET COUNTY AROUND LAKE TRAVIS
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 5:00 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 5:00 AM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WESTERN TRAVIS COUNTY AND FAR EASTERN BURNET COUNTY AROUND LAKE TRAVIS
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 5:00 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 5:00 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
